in_favor: Climate change requires a comprehensive approach to managing water resources
Integrated water resources management is more resilient to climate change, biodiversity loss and pollution
Countries with higher levels of integrated water resources management are more resilient
Water stress level measures all freshwater withdrawals relative to total freshwater resources
High water stress can have devastating consequences for the environment and sustainable development
against: Global progress in implementing integrated water resources management remains slow
Significant efforts to accelerate implementation are needed
Average global water stress level reached 18.6% in 2021
Central and Southern Asia facing high water stress, Northern Africa in critical stress
